case_vignette: A 17-year-old boy comes to the emergency department because of a 3-day history of pain in his left wrist. That morning the pain increased and he started to have chills and malaise. Last week he had self-resolving left knee pain. He is otherwise healthy and has not had any trauma to the wrist. He recently returned from a camping trip to Minnesota. He is sexually active with one female partner, who uses a diaphragm for contraception. His temperature is 37.7°C (99.9°F). Examination shows several painless violaceous vesiculopustular lesions on the dorsum of both wrists and hands; two lesions are present on the left palm. There is swelling and erythema of the left wrist with severe tenderness to palpation and passive movement.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having pain in my left wrist for three days, which got worse this morning, and I also started feeling chills and just generally unwell.
How old are you and are you male or female?
I'm a 17-year-old boy.
Have you had any recent injuries to your wrist or been involved in activities that could strain it?
No, I haven't had any trauma to the wrist.
Do you have any swelling, redness, or warmth in the affected wrist?
Yes, my left wrist is swollen and red, and it's very tender when touched or moved.
Have you had any fever, rash, or recent infections elsewhere in your body?
I have a mild fever of 37.7°C (99.9°F) and there are several painless purple blistery spots on the back of both my wrists and hands, with two spots on my left palm.
Do you have any known allergies, and are you currently taking any medication?
I'm healthy and haven't mentioned any allergies or medications.
Have you had any recent contact with animals, sick individuals, or traveled to any locations known for infectious diseases?
I recently returned from a camping trip to Minnesota.
Have you been bitten by any insects or ticks that you are aware of during your camping trip?
I didn't mention getting bitten by any insects or ticks.
Do you have any history of joint problems or autoimmune conditions, either personally or in your family?
I am otherwise healthy and haven't mentioned any personal or family history of joint problems or autoimmune conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Henoch-Schönlein purpura (HSP) with likely associated arthritis in the wrist.
